stream_context.summary: Kaze begins the first serious pass at overworld programming.  He reviews off-stream progress (Course 2 fixes), discusses star-count creep, sketches the intro cut-scene and level-unlock logic, models the Pachyderm gatekeeper, and debates co-op performance/design.  Frequent tool and performance concerns surface, while Biobak and Zeina work on graphics and animation off-stream.

development_findings.summary: Course 2 bug-fixing and polish is nearly finished; Kaze expects it "done by the end of the week" and will move on to Course 7 testing.
development_findings.quote: I've been doing a lot of work on course 2 off-stream… I think I'll be done with it by the end of the week.

development_findings.summary: The total star count has grown from the planned 185 to 193, and Kaze predicts they will add seven more overworld stars, potentially reaching 200.
development_findings.quote: If we put every piece of content that we thought to put into the game into the game now, we would end up with 200 stars and 193 stars… we started with… 185 stars and now we have 193.

development_findings.summary: Work begins on overworld scripting: tasks include the Pachyderm gate, temple door that opens after a star, cannon warp, bunny brushwoods, and general save-flag handling.
development_findings.quote: So, today we will be programming the overworld. I need a bop to bunny brushwoods… we need Pachyderm for that… temple door as a standard, collect the star and the door opens itself… then the cannon at part four exit.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is designing a new save-flag system (‘event flags’) because the overworld now contains 17 stars, exceeding the original CastleRunSecretStars bit-field.
development_findings.quote: How many stars do we have in the overworld now? 17. So these 16 bits are no good… We need to make new space for save flags in the EEP ROM.

development_findings.summary: Split-screen co-op is being prototyped: dialogue will temporarily take over full screen; single-player set-pieces (Raven fight, plane section) may swap control on hit; ‘closest player’ state will replace ‘G Mario’.  FPS is expected to drop from 30 → 20 but deemed acceptable.
development_findings.quote: Someone suggested what happens is that player screen is full screen… players swap whenever you get hit… multiplayer is probably going to drop… 30 FPS to 20 FPS… honestly, is it that bad?

development_findings.summary: Performance strategy for co-op: letterbox the halves to keep 16:9 while reducing pixel count, disable some visualisations, and refuse 480p mode due to memory limits.
development_findings.quote: Once you cut [4:3] in half… you will have black bars at the rims… makes it a lot cheaper to render… I'm not putting 480p mode in because that means I have to support the memory allocation.

development_findings.summary: Intro cut-scene concept revised: Mario sails to Yoshi’s Island, a Nap-E-Nut eats the boat, Mario swims ashore (teaching swim controls); only the lazy Yoshi is visible because the others were abducted.
development_findings.quote: My idea is… a Nap-E-Nut just munches your boat and Mario jumps off… the only Yoshi that's on the island is the lazy Yoshi.

development_findings.summary: Pachyderm model is in progress: initial AI-generated high-poly mesh is being optimized to ~140 triangles; intended as a pay-or-knock-over gatekeeper for Course 1, though gating method is under debate.
development_findings.quote: Obviously way too high poly… 242 triangles, I think we're fine… He is the guy that will ask you for 10 coins to enter course 1, or you can just ground-pound next to him and he will fall over.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 red-run material bug forces Kaze to switch to Eevee for overworld work, causing slowdowns.
development_findings.quote: For some reason this is just black… we have to switch to Eevee… Blender has gotten slow again because we're in Eevee.

development_findings.summary: A new gate asset is kit-bashed from Course 2 Yoshi doors; placeholder star texture was hand-edited to display a single-star requirement.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy: invest time in tools and research first (‘sharpening the axe’) to speed development later.
context_findings.quote: If he had six hours to cut down a tree, he would spend four hours sharpening his axe… that's kind of what we're doing.

context_findings.summary: He experiments with speaking only objectively provable statements, riffing on Kant and Vulcan logic.
context_findings.quote: I actually thought it would be a fun experiment to try and only say things in the way where they are objectively true.

context_findings.summary: Shows mild frustration at scope-creep accusations and tool crashes but remains upbeat.
Mentions legal/payment complications for Biobak but assures chat he "will be paid."
context_findings.quote: Well, there are some legal issues right now, but don't worry, he will be paid.

context_findings.summary: Personal asides: wants laser-eye surgery; delighted by repaired lawnmower with googly eyes; jokes about maximizing profit if he owned ‘AI that automates 90 % of jobs’.

biobak.summary: Currently reworking a stage and requests a smaller mission.
biobak.quote: Biobak is actually working on reworking this one right now. He wanted a smaller mission.

biobak.summary: Handling graphical rework (e.g., Course 2 assets, possible Yoshi gate).
Payment delayed due to unspecified legal issues; Kaze promises eventual compensation.
biobak.quote: There are some legal issues right now, but don't worry, he will be paid.

zeina.quote: Do we have a ball breaking scene in there yet? No. Zeina's working on the animation right now.

key_stories.title: Star-Count Creep
key_stories.summary: The project grew from a planned 185 to 193 stars, and Kaze anticipates at least seven more.  Chat teases him for scope creep, but he downplays the issue.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing ambitious content plans with project manageability.
key_stories.process: Kaze reviews all planned content and tallies current stars live on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Accepts the higher total and looks for seven additional overworld stars, possibly pushing the game to an even 200.
key_stories.key_quote: We started with a hack that had… 185 stars and now we have 193. Is it really an issue though?

key_stories.title: Split-Screen Co-op Feasibility
key_stories.summary: Kaze outlines technical and design hurdles for real-time two-player mode and brainstorms solutions with chat.
key_stories.challenge: Dialogue boxes halt gameplay; certain bosses and set-pieces assume one Mario; performance drops on N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Proposes full-screen takeover for dialogue, player-swap for single-player sections, ‘closest player’ state handling, and widescreen letterboxing to cut pixel cost.
key_stories.outcome: Concludes 20 FPS is acceptable and moves forward with prototyping.
key_stories.key_quote: Multiplayer is probably going to drop a 30 FPS level to 20 FPS, but 20 FPS on the N64—honestly, is it that bad?

key_stories.title: Course 1 Gate Debate
key_stories.summary: Initial plan: Pachyderm blocks the first course and demands 10 coins.  Chat and Biobak worry it feels like a chore.
key_stories.challenge: Teach overworld exploration without boring or frustrating players.
key_stories.process: Live discussion of alternatives (TNT, Bob-omb, giant boulder, Yoshi characters).
key_stories.outcome: Gate mechanism left unresolved; Pachyderm may be moved elsewhere.
key_stories.key_quote: I really, really want the player to collect 10 coins… but I see your point of it being somewhat of a chore.

key_stories.title: Intro Cut-scene Pivot
key_stories.summary: Original boat-arrival intro is upgraded by adding Nap-E-Nuts that destroy Mario’s boat, forcing him to swim ashore.
key_stories.challenge: Provide an exciting opening that naturally teaches swimming and establishes island danger.
key_stories.process: Kaze sketches the sequence live and notes required asset changes (remove docked boat, surround island with Nap-E-Nuts).
key_stories.outcome: New storyboard captured in overworld TODO list for future implementation.
key_stories.key_quote: A Nap-E-Nut just munches your boat and Mario jumps off… then you swim to the island while learning swimming controls.
